response_dde8dc5a1c8921320d8383726bdf80c: One of the easiest ways to improve the performance in your applications and reduce the server traffic is using HTTP Cache. Most modern browsers support HTTP caching. HTTP Cache is one of the reasons many websites are currently fast.
response_a1b56a2d3c1bf4146eff9541966fb92: HTTP Cache can be altered in the following header values sent by the application when serving a page for the first time:
response_c3a695bc001a06d635789bb46fb1a5c: * *Expires:* With this header the application can set a date in the future or the past telling the browser when the page must expire. * *Cache-Control:* This header allows to specify how much time a page should be considered fresh in the browser. * *Last-Modified:* This header tells the browser which was the last time the site was updated avoiding page re-loads * *ETag:* An etag is a unique identifier that must be created including the modification timestamp of the current page
